Definition: Given an article and a title, determine whether the title is appropriate for the article.

Positive Examples.input:
Article: kuwait on saturday held its biggest mock drill in preparation for possible iraqi missile retaliation against the backdrop of a us military strike against iraq. 
 Title: kuwait holds biggest mock drill against iraqi missle attack.
Positive Examples.explanation: The given title is correct for the given article as it captures the essence of the article that "kuwait held its biggest mock drill to prepare for iraq's missile attack".

Positive Examples.input:
Article: iranian anti-drug police have confiscated more than one ton of narcotic drugs in the past ## hours in kerman and khuzestan provinces , the irna news agency reported on saturday .

Positive Examples.explanation: The given title is about china's election for trade unions whereas the article is about iran police confisticating large amounts of narcotic drugs. As the title and article are not related. The output is "no".

Negative Examples.input:

Negative Examples.explanation: The given article is about uganda hosting africa boxing union convention for the first time whereas the title is about kuwait stock exchange. Hence, it is not a correct title so the output should be "no". The correct title for this article is "uganda to host abu convention".
